metadata.name: caipe-capabilities
metadata.description: CAIPE capabilities query - tests agent self-description and multi-agent coordination

parts.text:
## Execution Plan

1. List all available agents
2. Describe integration capabilities
3. Provide example use cases
4. Explain multi-agent orchestration
I'm an AI Platform Engineer that coordinates specialized agents to help with platform operations.

- **ArgoCD** - Kubernetes GitOps deployment management
- **GitHub** - Source code and repository operations
- **Jira** - Issue tracking and project management
- **AWS** - Cloud infrastructure operations
- **Slack** - Team communication and notifications
- **PagerDuty** - Incident management and on-call scheduling
- **Backstage** - Developer portal and service catalog
- **Splunk** - Log search and analysis
- **Komodor** - Kubernetes troubleshooting
- **Confluence** - Documentation and knowledge base

**Deployment & GitOps:**
- Sync and manage ArgoCD applications
- Check deployment status
- View application health

**Code & Repositories:**
- List pull requests and issues
- Search code repositories
- Get commit history

**Incident Management:**
- Find who's on-call
- Search logs for errors
- Track incident tickets

**Cloud Operations:**
- List AWS resources (EC2, S3, EKS, etc.)
- Check cloud costs
- Monitor infrastructure

**Communication:**
- Send notifications to Slack
- Post updates to Webex
- Create documentation in Confluence

## ðŸ’¡ Example Queries

- "Show ArgoCD applications in prod"
- "Find PRs with 'bug' label"
- "Who's on call for platform team?"
- "List EC2 instances in us-west-2"
- "Search logs for 500 errors in last hour"
- "Send deployment summary to #platform channel"
I use the **A2A Protocol** (Agent-to-Agent) to communicate with specialized sub-agents, providing you with a unified interface to your entire platform.

# CAIPE - Community AI Platform Engineering
